definition: variegated/heterogeneous/to refute/to contradict/to ship by barge/a barge/a lighter (ship)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
the solid and broken lines of the eight trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], e.g. ☶
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
to correct (in writing) sb's errors or misconceptions

sentences.english: We are waiting for the transshipment containers from the feeder barge being loaded to this voyage.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在等卸支线驳的中专集装箱转装到本航次上。

sentences.english: Mrs Linton spoke strongly, and yet I can't contradict her.
sentences.chinese: 林惇夫人说得过火些，可我驳不倒她。

sentences.english: The material of the balustrade bracket series is Stainless Steel 304 or 316.
sentences.chinese: 扶手驳接件的材质为优质304或316不锈钢。

sentences.english: Is the employee parking area separated from the shipping and receiving yards?
sentences.chinese: 设备的员工休息区域是和接货驳，发货驳分开的吗？

sentences.english: Is the employee parking area separated from the shipping and receiving yards?
sentences.chinese: 设备的员工休息区域是和接货驳，发货驳分开的吗？

sentences.english: He's going to need some irrefutable proof before he'll be willing to bend.
sentences.chinese: 他只会在不可辨驳的证据下才会愿意屈服。

definition: to warn/to blame/to rebuke/also written 申斥
to make excuses/to give an excuse (for not doing something)
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect
to disobey/to defy/deliberately going against (rule, convention, sb's wishes etc)
to stick up for a wrongdoer
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
